intro: Hackelia, commonly known as fairybells, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. These plants are native to North America and are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Hackelia species are typically herbaceous perennials or annuals, often growing in open woodlands or rocky areas. They have opposite, simple leaves and produce small, capsule-like fruits. The genus includes around 40 species, many of which are valued for their ornamental appeal in gardens.
